title: 115_hr6989
content: Restricting federal assistance benefits to verified citizens. Restriction on Federal assistance benefits eligibility based on citizenship requirement. The paragraph discusses the citizenship requirement for individuals receiving Federal assistance benefits. The individual must meet the attestation and citizenship verification requirements for Federal assistance benefits. The attestation requirement involves filing a written declaration under penalty of perjury. The individual must meet the citizenship verification requirement for Federal assistance benefits by providing satisfactory documentary evidence of U.S. citizenship. The individual must provide documentary evidence of U.S. citizenship, a photographic identity document, and nationality for Federal assistance benefits. The individual must provide their name, social security number, and citizenship or nationality status for confirmation in connection with the application for Federal assistance benefits. The individual must provide their name, social security number, and citizenship or nationality status for confirmation in connection with the application for Federal assistance benefits, as described in clause (i)(III). The entity must submit the individual's name and social security number to the Commissioner of Social Security for confirmation under clause (ii) of this subparagraph. Upon receipt, the Commissioner will confirm or deny the information provided. Upon receiving a submission from an entity, the Commissioner compares the information with records and confirms the validity of the submitted number and citizenship status through the Social Security Administration. Confirmation can also be done through the Department of Homeland Security. An entity receiving identity information must submit it to the Secretary of Homeland Security for confirmation. Upon receiving identity information, the Secretary of Homeland Security will confirm whether the individual is a US citizen or national. Verification can also be done through the SAVE program. An entity receiving identity information must verify the individual's noncitizen status through the SAVE Program. Individuals who do not provide required documentation must receive confirmation. The entity processing the application for Federal assistance benefits must notify individuals who do not receive confirmation of citizenship or nationality of their ineligibility and provide them with the opportunity to appeal. The head of any federal department or agency administering the benefits must oversee the appeals process. The Federal Government agency administering a benefit program must provide a process for individuals to appeal if deemed ineligible for Federal assistance benefits. The term "national" refers to a U.S. national. Additional rules and administration guidelines are outlined, including treatment of certain families and households. Treatment of certain families and households for Federal assistance benefits is outlined. Children can meet citizenship requirements if a parent or legal guardian does, and household members can meet the requirement if any individual in the household does. Treatment of families and households for Federal assistance benefits: any individual in the household meets the citizenship requirement, except for elderly individuals in supportive housing programs. The citizenship requirement for Federal assistance benefits must be met by a disabled individual in supportive housing programs under section 811 of the Cranston-Gonzalez National Affordable Housing Act. Once this requirement is satisfied, the individual shall be eligible for the benefit. The Director of the Office of Management and Budget may issue regulations and guidance for Federal assistance benefits eligibility. Declaration form and verification process specifications must be provided within 30 days of the Act's enactment. The Director must specify the citizenship declaration form and verification method within 30 days of the Act's enactment, based on the Social Security Act form. The provisions of this section supersede any laws related to eligibility for Federal assistance based on citizenship, nationality, or immigration status, unless determined otherwise by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The Office of Management and Budget can disqualify entities for willful and repeated noncompliance with citizenship requirements for Federal assistance benefits. Entities can be disqualified from providing benefits if they fail to comply with citizenship requirements, and their names will be added to the List of Excluded Individuals/Entities until benefits are recovered. Inspectors general for Federal assistance programs must monitor compliance with the requirements. Entities providing benefits under the program must comply with citizenship requirements, or they may be disqualified and listed as excluded until benefits are recovered. Inspectors general of Federal assistance programs are responsible for monitoring compliance. The term "Federal assistance program" includes any provision of Federal law that authorizes benefits based on the income or resources of the beneficiary, excluding tax laws. Effective Date: Subsection (a) applies to eligibility determinations made 1 year after the enactment of this Act. Individuals must meet citizenship requirements within 2 years of the Act to remain eligible for Federal assistance benefits.
